Class Parking

java.lang.Object
src.Parking
class Parking extends Object
Simulating process of parking by allowing and departing cars.

    • getRandom

      protected static int getRandom(int rnd)
      Return a random number.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • valueInRange

      private static int valueInRange(int numOfParts)
      Find value in a given range of 0 (Included) and numOfParts (Excluded) based on generated random number. .
      Parameters:
      numOfParts - represents range in which value in needed (excluding last value).
      Returns:
      randomNum represents a random number in given range. Example - If value is needed between 0 and 2 i.e. 0 or 1 or 2, numOfParts should be 3.

    • simulateHour

      protected void simulateHour(int ipk, int iHour, int[] parking, int[] time, int[] totPaid, int[] totIn, int[] totRefused, int[] totHours)
      Simulate working of given parking lot in particular given hour. Store data obtained from simulation for given hour. Parking lot accept cars by rules - between 6.00 AM to 5.59 PM with equal probability of 5 to 9 cars per hour. - between 6.00 PM to 8.59 PM with equal probability of 1 to 2 cars per hour. Cars can depart when they exhaust their parking hours.
      Parameters:
      ipk - number representing which parking lot is being simulated. (Starts from 0)
      iHour - number representing particular hour for a day between 0 and 23 (both included).
      parking - array representing individual cars parked by their parking hours in particular parking lot.
      time - array representing remaining time for individual cars parked in particular parking lot.
      totPaid - store total amount paid by cars departed from a particular parking lot. Indexed by parking lot being simulated.
      totIn - store total cars allowed in a particular parking lot. Indexed by parking lot being simulated.
      totRefused - store total cars refused in a particular parking lot. Indexed by parking lot being simulated.
      totHours - store summation of parking hours of all cars for a particular parking lot. Indexed by parking lot being simulated.

    • departCars

      private static void departCars(int ipk, int[] parking, int[] time, int[] totHours, int[] totPaid)
      Simulate process of car departing - reduce parking hours by one hour for all parked car. - if a car's parking hours are exhausted, calculate parking cost and depart the car, making the space available.
      Parameters:
      ipk - represent number of parking lot.
      parking - array representing all parked cars in given parking lot by their parking hours. (0 means space available)
      time - array representing remaining time for each parked car. (0 means car departed)
      totHours - store total parking hours (of all cars) for a parking lot, calculated when cars depart.
      totPaid - store total amount paid by all cars in a parking lot, calculated when cars depart.

    • calculateCost

      private static int calculateCost(int hours)
      Calculate cost of parking a car for given number of hours. Maximum cost for a day (24 hours) is 20 (constant DAILY_COST). Per hour cost is 3 (constant HOURLY_COST).
      Parameters:
      hours - representing number of parking hours.
      Returns:
      cost representing calculated cost of parking.

    • parkCars

      private static boolean parkCars(int ipk, int[] parking, int[] time, int[] totIn, int[] totRefused)
      Simulate process of parking a car in given parking lot. If space available in parking lot, - Calculate random parking hours for a car. (Between 1 and 72(constant HOUR_MAX) ) - Park the car. - Increase number of cars allowed in a parking lot. Else increase number of refused cars in parking lot.
      Parameters:
      ipk - represent number of given parking lot.
      parking - array represents individual parked car in parking lot.
      time - array represents remaining time of all car parked.
      totIn - represents total cars allowed in given parking lot.
      totRefused - represents total cars refused in given parking lot.
      Returns:
      a boolean value representing true if car is parked and false if no space was available.
